ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: If good comes to him he holds back his hand,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and tight-fisted when good fortune visits him,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: but when they are fortunate, they become niggardly
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And refraining, when good reaches him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And suppressive when good touches him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And niggardly when good befalls him
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And, when good befalleth him, grudging;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and whenever good fortune comes to him, he grows niggardly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And when good toucheth him he is begrudging.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and grudging [charity] when good comes his way
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And niggardly when good reaches him;-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And niggardly when good touches him;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: but when good comes upon him, he is grudging
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Touched by good, he is ungenerous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And when good touches him, withholding [of it],
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [70:21] and when good befalls him, [he is] grudging, at the point of that good befalling [him], that is to say, [when] wealth [befalls him], [he is grudging to give] of it what is due to God;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And, when good) wealth and abundance (befalleth him, grudging) he does not give thanks and withholds the right of Allah which is due from it;
